One day, the toy car stopped moving. The cat did not know why.
Her friend, the wise old dog, came to help. The dog looked at the toy car and said, "The car needs a new battery to go." The cat did not know what a battery was. The dog showed her a small thing that made the car work again. The cat was very happy.
The cat and dog played with the toy car all day. They learned that if they worked together, they could solve any problem. The cat and dog became the best of friends. The moral of the story is that friends can help you solve

Tom was from another place, so he spoke a different language. Lucy and Tom wanted to play together, but they didn't understand each other's words. They felt sad.
Lucy had an idea. She gave Tom her messy doll to hold. They both smiled and started to play. They learned that even if they spoke different languages, they could still be friends. The moral of the story is that we can find ways to be friends with others, even if we are different.

to leave the house.

Mom sighed. She took Tom by the hand and brought him inside. She told him to take off his shoes and put them in the sink. She said he had to wash them and dry them. She also said he could not play outside for the rest of the day.

stopped and felt sad. He watched helplessly as the balloons floated far away into the sky.
The next morning, Tim woke up feeling a bit more hesitant about going to the mailbox. But when he arrived, he found that all the balloons had returned and were now tied together to a post near his mailbox. The wind had brought them back to him! 
Tim was overjoyed and cried tears of happiness. He learned an important lesson: always be kind and patient as your treats will always come back!

One day, a boy named Tim wanted to play a sport. He liked to be healthy and have fun. Tim asked his mom, "Can I go out and play with my friends?"
His mom said, "Yes, but first you must dress in your sport clothes." Tim put on his shirt, shorts, and shoes. He was ready to play. He ran outside to meet his friends.
They started to play a game of ball. They were all having fun. Then, something unexpected happened.

would work all day in the hot sun, carrying food to his ant friends. One day, he met a lazy grasshopper who did not like to work.
"Why do you work so much?" asked the grasshopper. "Come and play with me." But the ant said, "No, I must work. Winter is coming, and we need food."
The grasshopper laughed and said, "You worry too much. I will be fine." But the ant did not listen and kept working.
